sourcesContent: import React from 'react'; import { motion } from 'framer-motion'; import { Box, VStack, HStack, Heading, Text, Icon, Code, useColorModeValue } from '@chakra-ui/react'; import { HelpCircle } from 'lucide-react'; export function Instructions() { const bgColor = useColorModeValue('yellow.50', 'yellow.900'); const borderColor = useColorModeValue('yellow.200', 'yellow.700'); return ( üìñ How to Use üéØ Getting Started: ‚Ä¢ The app automatically detects and loads available flashcard sets ‚Ä¢ Click on any file in the "Available Flashcard Sets" section to load it ‚Ä¢ Use the "Change Set" button to switch between different sets üì§ Adding New Content: ‚Ä¢ Convert your PDF using the command-line tool: python utils/pdf_converter.py your_file.pdf ‚Ä¢ Upload the generated JSON file using the upload section ‚Ä¢ The new set will appear in your available files list üìÅ Manual Setup (Already have JSON files): ‚Ä¢ Copy your JSON files directly to the flashcard-data folder: cp your_flashcards.json public/flashcard-data/ ‚Ä¢ Add set information to the metadata file: python utils/add_flashcard_set.py your_flashcards.json "Set Title" "Description" "Category" "Difficulty" ‚Ä¢ Refresh the app to see your new flashcard set üìã JSON Format Required: Your JSON file must have this structure: {`{ "flashcards": [ { "question": "Your question here?", "answer": "Your answer here", "question_number": 1, "format": "multiple_choice" } ] }`} ); }
